newsitem.title: CANADA: GM Canada Chevy, Buick car plants idled.
newsitem.headline: GM Canada Chevy, Buick car plants idled.

text.p: General Motors Corp's Canadian unit said on Friday it idled two of its Oshawa, Ontario car assembly plants until further notice due to a three-day-old strike at the carmaker's Warren, Michigan parts plant.

GM Canada spokesman Chick McGregor said Oshawa plants 1 and 2, which make Chevrolet Lumina and Monte Carlo model cars and Buick Regal and Century models, were idled after Thursday's night shift and would remain down "until further notice."
The plants employ about 5,200 workers and produce about 2,000 cars a day, McGregor said.
Oshawa's truck plant was unaffected by the strike.
More than 16,900 GM workers in North America have been affected by the work stoppage in Warren.
About 2,800 workers walked off the job at the transmission, wheel and suspension parts plant in suburban Detroit late Tuesday night over demands for more jobs.
GM said in a statement it would not speculate on when or which additional facilities could be affected by the strike.
